reviews.name: The World of Ice & Fire: The Untold History of Westeros and the Game of Thrones
reviews.reviewText: I got this as a gift but just had to look through it first. The book feels classy with a padded cover and the illustrations are amazing. Haven't read it very thoroughly, but this would be a great addition to the World of Ice and Fire fan's library.
reviews.title: Classy Book

reviews.name: The World of Ice & Fire: The Untold History of Westeros and the Game of Thrones
reviews.reviewText: my son was so happy w. this book.
reviews.title: best present ever!

reviews.name: The World of Ice & Fire: The Untold History of Westeros and the Game of Thrones
reviews.reviewText:
This is a classy book. The cover is padded, and the texture gives it a hint of leather, or something more than typical slick covers. The illustrations in it are often from fandom, having each been chosen by the author because they epitomize the topic covered in a particular set of pages. The pages are not black type on white typical book pages. They are rich colors, with frequent illustrations enhancing the text. If you're a Games of Thrones fan, particularly of the books, you should love this volume that enhancing by filling in more of George Martin's world.
This was a gift for my 21 year old son. He was even more impressed with it than he thought he'd be from the literary and fan reviews and descriptions.
I shopped around, and Wal-Mart had the cheapest price. I combined it with another item (that frankly I could've just shopped for at our local stores) to reach the threshold for free shipping. It was nice to have them delivered to the house instead of having to wait in lines, and then wait for them to find it in their back rooms, at the store pickup!!
reviews.title: Elegant presentation - Impressive
